body_html:
Hello vinit13792; I have followed this steps and I have finally managed to execute on jupyter notebook:
import tensorflow as tf

a = tf.Variable(1, name="a")
b = tf.Variable(2, name="b")
f = a + b

init = tf.global_variables_initializer()
with tf.Session() as s:
init.run()
print( f.eval() )

Step 1: install canopy (version 2.1.6)
Step 2: on the editor (NOT the command editor type and execute: !pip install pydotplus
Step 3: on the command editor I typed and executed: pip install tensorflow==1.10.0
however with this I got a very strange error of Permissions
Step 4: back on the Canopy editor type and execute: !pip install tensorflow
and also; !pip install keras

And with this I managed to finally get results!!

Hope it helps

Hi AlvaroSSM, i tried the exact same steps which you mentioned above, and i still ended up having the same error. Any pointers as to what to do next? I have cnopy version 2.1.9
body_text:
Hello vinit13792; I have followed this steps and I have finally managed to execute on jupyter notebook:
import tensorflow as tf
a = tf.Variable(1, name="a")
b = tf.Variable(2, name="b")
f = a + b
init = tf.global_variables_initializer()
with tf.Session() as s:
init.run()
print( f.eval() )
Step 1: install canopy (version 2.1.6)
Step 2: on the editor (NOT the command editor type and execute: !pip install pydotplus
Step 3: on the command editor I typed and executed: pip install tensorflow==1.10.0
however with this I got a very strange error of Permissions
Step 4: back on the Canopy editor type and execute: !pip install tensorflow
and also; !pip install keras
And with this I managed to finally get results!!
Hope it helps

Hi AlvaroSSM, i tried the exact same steps which you mentioned above, and i still ended up having the same error. Any pointers as to what to do next? I have cnopy version 2.1.9
